story.title: Elfin Around - Episode 1
story.storyDescription: Sara: I know what you want for Christmas.
story.creator: web-uploader

messages.text: I know what you want for Christmas.
What?
Isn’t it obvious? You can’t stop staring at him.
Olivia sighs as she watches the cute guy across the mall.
He works in IntenCity, the clothing store across from her Santa booth.
She’s supposed to be focusing on the kids waiting in line…
But she can’t take her eyes off him.
Are you ever going to talk to him?
He’s way too hot.
And besides, I look ridiculous.
They both do.
They’re dressed as elves in Santa’s Village.
And the red and green uniforms are horrific.
Sara shrugs.
You never know.
Maybe he’s got a fetish for big pointy shoes with bells on them.
In that case, he would love me.
Olivia does a little dance to make the jingle bells ring.
You’re going to have to talk to him one day.
Or…I can just keep staring at him from a distance.
That’s a good option too.
Sara rolls her eyes.
Stop it.
Wait, here’s your chance!
I think he’s going on break.
Olivia’s heart starts pounding.
She watches him talk to his manager, and then leave the store.
He starts walking towards her…
But then she turns away in a panic.
Smooth…
Shut up. I can’t let him see me like this!
Sara turns to their boss, the head elf.
Olivia is taking her break!
Fine. Whatever.
Sara gives Olivia a firm, two-handed push on her back.
Go talk to him!
But I look like a freak!
Not possible. You look hot!
Glitter is sexy!
Olivia vehemently disagrees.
And to make matters worse, she has it all over her cheeks.
Do you want to be single for ANOTHER Christmas?
Or do you want a hot boyfriend this year?
So you can snuggle up with him in front of the fire?
Olivia takes a deep breath and nods
Alright, I’ll go talk to him.
She races through the mall, following the hot guy to the coffee kiosk.
She slips in line behind him and orders a coffee, matching the one he’s holding.
All of the tables are full.
So when he leans against the railing and starts scanning his phone…
Olivia approaches him.
Her pulse is racing.
She’s so close that she can see the name written on his coffee cup.
Zac.
Olivia smiles. It suits him.
Hello…Zac.
He looks up, confusion etched on his face.
How did you…?
Oh, my coffee cup.
Olivia nods.
I’m Olivia, and I…
Zac sighs, taking in her elf uniform.
Before Olivia realizes what’s happening…
He pulls out a handful of change and tosses it into her cup of coffee.
The resulting splash sounds like a slap.
Hey!
He jerks his head back in surprise.
Oh, crap! I thought you were collecting money for charity.
Nope. Just trying to drink my coffee.
I’m so sorry.
Then he raises an eyebrow.
Why are you dressed like an elf?
Because it’s the style, obviously.
She gives him a playful smirk and he smiles back.
I can see why. Bright green tights are so sexy.
I know, right?
Can I get you another coffee?
Unless…you like the taste of pennies?
Not really. And yeah, I wouldn’t mind another a dose of caffeine.
You know, so I don’t start attacking the children.
Zac laughs.
We wouldn’t want that. How do you take your coffee?
With a little bit of milk. And no metal coins.
He laughs again, as he goes back to the counter to replace her cup.
Here you go. One sanitary coffee.
She smiles as she takes it.
So, why are you really dressed like an elf?
I work in Santa’s Village.
The one in the mall, not the real one.
Not the real one?
Olivia drops her head in dismay.
She’s been fantasizing about this moment for weeks…
And now that it’s here, she’s completely blowing it.
Oh, cool. I work at IntenCity. I’m just on break.
Olivia already knew that.
In fact, she knew his schedule by heart.
These crowds are insane. They’re slowly killing me.
I know a secret place where we can escape the madness…
Wanna go?
Zac perks up.
Really?
Olivia grins.
Yeah. Follow me.
They chat easily as they walked back to Santa’s Village.
In here.
Santa’s Workshop?
Seriously? Surrounded by screaming children?
Olivia laughs.
Not back here.
Olivia pulls back one of the plastic panels of the workshop structure.
And she reveals tiny space, just big enough for two.
Together, they sneak inside.
It isn’t very luxurious, but it’s quiet.
This is amazing.
Santa’s Village is full of surprises.
So are his elves.
They sat on the ground and sip their cups of coffee in peace.
Zac pulls out his phone and starts playing a song she’s heard before.
He nods along to the music.
The acoustics aren’t bad in here either.
I’m glad you approve.
You’re welcome to hide in here on your breaks.
Are you going to be in here with me?
I could be…
Then I’d love to.
Her cheeks start to get a little hotter as he smiles at her.
They talk for the rest of their break.
Olivia is thrilled that they’re actually hitting it off.
She knew he was cute, but now she realizes he’s funny and smart.
There’s just one thing she doesn’t know yet…
Are you finished all of your Christmas shopping?
Almost. I still have to get my Dad something.
What about your girlfriend?
Are you finished shopping for her?
She was easy to shop for since she doesn’t exist.
Olivia can barely hide her smile.
What about you? Are you done shopping for your boyfriend?
I don’t have one either.
Now it’s Zac’s turn to smile.
A charge fills the air between them as they watch each other for a long moment.
Oh crap! My break was over eight minutes ago.
Mine too.
When is your next break?
In January.
They both laugh.
Zac drains his cup, turns the music off, and puts his phone back in his pocket.
We should do this again. Maybe on our next shift?
Yeah, definitely. My next shift is on Tuesday.
Tuesday?
He looks disappointed.
That’s so far away.
Olivia laughs.
You only have to wait two days.
How about I meet you after work?
We can do something fun.
Olivia grins as her heart speeds up.
Okay. I’d like that.
But you’ll have to promise me one thing?
What?
You’ll wear the elf outfit, green tights and all.
Olivia laugh.
I don’t think so…
Come on. I’m really starting to dig them.
Olivia laughs again.
We’ll see.
I’ll see you in a bit. Good luck with the kids.
He gives her one last killer smile and then sneaks out of Santa’s Workshop.
And Olivia goes back to work.
Her head is spinning.
She has a date with her crush!
Maybe he’ll be the one she snuggles up to this Christmas…
Just then, her fantasies get interrupted by her boss’s curt voice.
Where were you?
You’re late.
Elf business.
I was working on a Christmas miracle.
Her boss rolls her eyes and walks away.
Don’t let it happen again!
But Olivia isn’t listening.
She’s too busy daydreaming about her date…
And watching Zac working at the store.
He looks up and catches her eye from across the mall.
A shiver runs through her.
Maybe she’ll keep on the green tights after all.
